alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 12:20PM EST until February 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky, south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Estill, Menifee and Powell. In south central Kentucky, Rockcastle. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Clay, Jackson, Lee, Magoffin, Morgan, Owsley and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1219 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Around 2 inches of rain has already fallen across the warned area, with another 1 to 2 inches of rain expected through tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Liberty, Irvine, Mount Vernon, Jackson, Beattyville, McKee, Campton, Booneville, Boone, Simpson, Henry, Lewis, Fincastle, Ravenna, Mount Olive, Proctor, Maloney, White Ash, Corgleton and Belle Point.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
